p: The inappropriate use of blood components included platelets as well as Fresh Frozen Plasma (FFP). Two patients received FFP transfusion without criteria. To our knowledge, no studies have evaluated the use of FFP in cases of dengue; however, studies of other diseases have indicated that approximately 30–50% of FFP transfusions are prophylactic with or without a planned procedure, and a large proportion (up to 50%) of FFP transfusions do not follow guidelines [ 40– 42].
